Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2014 07:19PM Miasmommy wrote: Thanks for the responses! I will keep you posted after my exam (3/10). I will try to keep my hands off my boobs in the meantime haha. I can get a little obsessive.
Posts.Title: Doctor says get a baseline at 31..? Miasmommy wyo

Posts.Content: Miasmommy wrote: I just had a regular physical in which the doctor noticed my fibro breasts were particularly lumpy. She said I should go ahead and get a baseline mammogram now instead of waiting until 35. There was one lump she focused on on the upper left breast. She gave me the sheet with the number to call and make an appointment. I can't get in until the 10th of March. Should I be worried? The lump is hard, slightly rolling feel to it (moves back and forth), long oval shaped. Pain in my breasts comes and goes. It doesn't hurt all the time.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Doctor says get a baseline at 31..? Miasmommy wyo

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2014 12:52PM Miasmommy wrote: My paternal grandmother died of BC, she was in her 60s. I also opted for the tomosynthesis in addition to the mammogram. Hopefully that will help get a clear diagnosis.
